column4: can anyone tell me why the newest alternate, and desktop cd won't function?  i believe it must be gnome... when i install with the alternate CD, i can login, but then it just hangs on the orange background.. mouse still works, the live CD, won't load the desktop unless in safe graphics mode..
what can i do here?
i know how to get to a failsafe terminal..
did you md5 check the iso and verify the cd was consistant once burned?
yes I did indeed.
good, thats one possibility out of the way
you could try disabling things like dma / acpi
did that as well..
checked ram health and hard drive health?
yes..
disabled unnecessary hardware in bios
I do that anyways....  and beside that.. safe graphics DOES work..
can you boot to root console and create a new user, see if logging in with that user works ok
did that too..
tried upgrading your system from root console?
i did set a root password, login, and do apt-get update
oh dear, enabling the root account is not a good idea
it doesn't matter, the machine is not connected to the network.. i was just testing..
is there a way to update all installed packages with apt-get if I was to connect it to the network?
sudo dpkg-reconfigure xserver-xorg
did that already as well..
will set your xorg to defaults
i'd also add: sudo apt-get dist-upgrade
yes
